purchase.title: Labratory Purchase System

blocks.title: System Overview
description: Developed using React and Firebase.
A system for managing laboratory purchases.
Allows users to submit purchase requests, which are then reviewed by administrators.
When the status is updated, notifications are displayed on the applicant's screen and sent to the linked Discord.

blocks.title: Applicant Interface
description: Allows users to submit purchase requests.
Requests can be edited later, and the update date and time are recorded.
Includes a product URL and comment field for practicality.

blocks.title: Administrator Interface
description: Allows administrators to review purchase requests and update the status.
Approval, purchase processing, and other status updates are sent to Discord.

blocks.title: Notification Function
description: When the status is updated, notifications are displayed on the applicant's screen and sent to the linked Discord.
Also, the notification is displayed in the bell mark in the upper right corner.

purchase.note: * Currently requires login authentication due to API usage restrictions.

tex.title: Img2LaTex Converter

blocks.title: Main Screen
description: Developed using React.
An application that generates LaTeX code from mathematical equations in images.
Uses Gemini API for image analysis and LaTeX code generation.
Features a "Explain the Equation" button that displays a simple explanation of the equation.

blocks.title: Result Display
description: Displays the generated LaTeX code and explains the equation with a "Explain the Equation" button.
Also, a copy button is configured to copy the code to the clipboard.
A snackbar is displayed at the top of the screen to confirm that the code has been copied.

blocks.title: Handwritten Equations are also Recognized
description: Handwritten equations are also recognized.
This example is a complex Ramanujan formula that includes exponents and factorials, but it is recognized without any issues.

tex.note: * Currently requires login authentication due to API usage restrictions.

blocks.title: Main Screen
description: Frontend: React, Backend: Python
Receives user input and automatically generates a thread like "2ch" of appropriate content.
The thread can be expanded by replying to it, and the thread can be further expanded by replying to the reply.

blocks.title: Parameters
description: Users can change the parameters of the thread, such as the number of threads (the number of replies that will be expanded) and keywords.
The keywords can be changed to change the tone and content of the thread.
As "danger level", users can set the degree of rudeness of the thread.
Also, users can set keywords like "nanJ" and "Otaku" to change the tone and content of the thread.

blocks.title: System Architecture
description: Users use AWS Cognito for login and authentication.
API Gateway is used to control the generation model.
The generation models are Claude3 Haiku and Stable Diffusion, with Amazon Bedrock for orchestration.

blocks.title: Our Team
description: We are a team of five people who participated in the Progate √ó AWS Hackathon 2024.
All of us had no experience with hackathons, but we won the grand prize in our first attempt!

blocks.title: Main Screen
description: Quantum circuit simulator using React, Django, and Qiskit
Easy simulation of quantum operations on the browser.
The configuration information of the quantum circuit is sent to the backend, and the execution result of the quantum circuit is obtained as an API.
